meanings.definition: A lively dance of Bohemian origin in duple time.
meanings.sent1: At the village fair, everyone joined in the polkas, twirling and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The band played a catchy polkas tune that got everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent3: During the polkas, Grandma surprised us all with her fancy footwork.
meanings.sent4: The polkas filled the room with energy, like a whirlwind of joy.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the polkas lingered in their hearts, a dance of happiness.
meanings.sent6: Excited children practiced the polkas in the town square, eager to show off their moves.
meanings.sent7: The polkas echoed through the streets, drawing people out of their homes to join the fun.

meanings.definition: A piece of music for this dance.
meanings.sent1: The polkas melody was so catchy that it stayed in my head all day.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played a beautiful polkas that had everyone swaying to the rhythm.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, they set the polkas tune as the alarm clock, waking up to dance every morning.
meanings.sent4: The polkas music flowed through the air, lifting spirits like a musical breeze.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the polkas felt like being wrapped in a warm blanket of sound.
